CPSC 110.name: Computation, Programs, and Programming
CPSC 110.description: Fundamental program and computation structures. Introductory programming skills. Computation as a tool for information processing, simulation and modeling, and interacting with the world.

CPSC 210.name: Software Construction
CPSC 210.description: Design, development, and analysis of robust software components. Topics such as software design, computational models, data structures, debugging, and testing.

CPSC 121.name: Models of Computation
CPSC 121.description: Design, development, and analysis of robust software components. Topics such as software design, computational models, data structures, debugging, and testing.

CPSC 213.name: Introduction to Computer Systems
CPSC 213.description: Software architecture, operating systems, and I/O architectures. Relationships between application software, operating systems, and computing hardware; critical sections, deadlock avoidance, and performance; principles and operation of disks and networks.

CPSC 221.name: Basic Algorithms and Data Structures
CPSC 221.description: Design and analysis of basic algorithms and data structures; algorithm analysis methods, searching and sorting algorithms, basic data structures, graphs and concurrency.

CPSC 304.name: Introduction to Relational Databases
CPSC 304.description: Design, development, and analysis of robust software components. Topics such as software design, computational models, data structures, debugging, and testing.

CPSC 313.name: Computer Hardware and Operating Systems
CPSC 313.description: Instruction sets, pipelining, code optimization, caching, virtual memory management, dynamically linked libraries, exception processing, execution time of programs.

CPSC 314.name: Computer Graphics
CPSC 314.description: Human vision and colour; geometric transformations; algorithms for 2-D and 3-D graphics; hardware and system architectures; shading and lighting; animation.

CPSC 317.name: Internet Computing
CPSC 317.description: Computer networking, basic communication protocols, network infrastructure and routing. Common application-level protocols and principles associated with developing distributed applications.

CPSC 319.name: Software Engineering Project
CPSC 319.description: The design, implementation, and test of a large software system, using a team approach.

CPSC 320.name: Intermediate Algorithm Design and Analysis
CPSC 320.description: Systematic study of basic concepts and techniques in the design and analysis of algorithms, illustrated from various problem areas. Topics include: models of computation; choice of data structures; graph-theoretic, algebraic, and text processing algorithms.

CPSC 340.name: Machine Learning and Data Mining
CPSC 340.description: Models of algorithms for dimensionality reduction, nonlinear regression, classification, clustering and unsupervised learning; applications to computer graphics, computer games, bio-informatics, information retrieval, e-commerce, databases, computer vision and artificial intelligence.

CPSC 322.name: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
CPSC 322.description: Problem-solving and planning; state/action models and graph searching. Natural language understanding Computational vision. Applications of artificial intelligence.

CPSC 344.name: Introduction to Human Computer Interaction Methods
CPSC 344.description: Basic tools and techniques, teaching a systematic approach to interface design, task analysis, analytic and empirical evaluation methods.
